item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 16, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. No Calls (606 points | 163 comments)
2. Same three bands appear in three different presentations with different labels (103 points | 52 comments)
3. David Lynch has passed away (195 points | 49 comments)
4. Nepenthes is a tarpit to catch AI web crawlers (284 points | 108 comments)
5. FEMA: Never donate clothing (it is never needed) (7 points | 1 comment)
6. I Ditched the Algorithm for RSS–and You Should Too (219 points | 95 comments)
7. David Lynch, Twin Peaks and Muholland Drive director, dies aged 78 (95 points | 6 comments)
8. 2k-year-old wine and the uncanny immediacy of the past (79 points | 19 comments)
9. Test-Driven Development with an LLM for Fun and Profit (50 points | 9 comments)
10. Artie (YC S23) Is Hiring a Founding Engineer (Distributed Systems) ( | hide)
11. Physically Based Rendering: From Theory to Implementation (50 points | 11 comments)
12. Let's Encrypt is offering 6-day and IP address certs (39 points | 10 comments)
13. I am offering mentoring: In which I help you (19 points | 27 comments)
14. Show HN: DBOS TypeScript – Lightweight Durable Execution Built on Postgres (24 points | 17 comments)
15. Show HN: I made an open source directory of where to showoff your projects (113 points | 20 comments)
16. Device uses wind to create ammonia out of air (69 points | 58 comments)
17. Five Years of React Native at Shopify (43 points | 10 comments)
18. Stretching Each Dollar: Diffusion Training from Scratch on a Micro-Budget (6 points | discuss)
19. Oh Shit, Git? (43 points | 15 comments)
20. Replit CEO on AI breakthroughs: We don't care about professional coders anymore (38 points | 36 comments)
21. The Conundrum of Life's Origin (31 points | 13 comments)
22. Nintendo announces the Switch 2 [video] (502 points | 670 comments)
23. Nokia's internal presentation after iPhone was launched (2007) [pdf] (362 points | 374 comments)
24. GitHub Linux ARM64 hosted runners now available for free in public repositories (58 points | 6 comments)
25. Understanding Memory Management, Part 1: C (123 points | 37 comments)
26. Why some DVLA digital services don't work at night (44 points | 43 comments)
27. Mathematicians Discover New Way for Spheres to 'Kiss' (118 points | 49 comments)
28. Intel's Tofino P4 Software Is Now Open Source (182 points | 60 comments)
29. Penn Station Can Handle the Load: New York Is Ready for Through-Running (9 points | 1 comment)
30. Red Hat Woos VMware Shops with OpenShift Virtualization Engine (78 points | 39 comments)
